title: Natural Experiments: When Life Runs the Trial
description: A 60-second lesson on Natural Experiments: When Life Runs the Trial.

hook.text: You can't randomly assign people to poverty to study its effects. But a lottery did it accidentally.

discovery.text: The Vietnam draft lottery randomly assigned men to military service, letting economists study the effects of war.

twist.text: Joshua Angrist and Guido Imbens won the 2021 Nobel Prize for developing natural experiment methods.

climax.text: Natural experiments let researchers study causation in situations where randomized trials are impossible.

punchline.text: Life runs experiments. Statisticians just notice.
